The Great Plague

During the later half of the 2100's deep sea oil mining became the main source of fossil fuel. However locked within this deep sea biomass for 100's of millions of years a virus laid dormant. "The Great Plague" also known as Necro-Pelagicia Virus attacked the host's brain and with a 90% fatality rate in primates it wiped out over 50% of the human population, roughly 5 billion people, in the span of 7 years. Out of the remaining 50% of the survivors over half were left infertile due to a side effect of the vaccination.
